title: How to Make a Detox Smoothie

methods.name: Blending a Green Protein Detox Smoothie

steps.headline: Choose the mixed greens that you want to use.
steps.description: Any combination of greens will work for the smoothie, but kale, chard, and spinach are popular options. Romaine and arugula can also work well. If you're new to green smoothies, it's best to start with spinach or chard, which both have mild flavors. Kale is high in beta carotene, vitamin K, vitamin C, calcium, and fiber, as well as antioxidants. But while it's extremely healthy, it has a strong, semi-bitter flavor and fibrous texture that can take some getting used to. Start with a small amount in your smoothie to get used to the flavor.

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients in a blender.
steps.description: Add ½ cup (118 ml) of unsweetened almond milk, 1 tablespoon (16 g) of almond butter, 1 banana, and 2 cups (150 g) of mixed greens to the pitcher of a blender. It’s best to use a high-speed blender, which will have an easier time pulverizing all of the ingredients. You can substitute another nut milk, dairy milk, soy milk, coconut water, or plain water for the almond milk if you prefer. If you want a cold smoothie, you can add some ice to the mixture as well.

steps.headline: Blend the mixture until it’s smooth.
steps.description: It’s best to start the blender on a low speed and gradually increase it to avoid damaging the motor. If you don’t have a high-speed blender, try pulsing the blender multiple times instead of leaving it on for a prolonged period of time. The finished smoothie should have a thick but pourable consistency. You can double or triple the recipe to make additional servings for the future. Store the leftover smoothie in an airtight container for up to three days.

steps.headline: Pour the smoothie into a glass and drink.
steps.description: The recipe makes enough for a single smoothie. Add it to your favorite travel mug, and enjoy it as a replacement for your meals for three days to fully detox.

steps.headline: Add all of the ingredients to a blender.
steps.description: Place 1 ½ cups (210 g) of mixed berries, ½ cup (118 ml) of coconut milk, 1 cup (237 ml) of filtered water, and ⅛ cup (15 g) of rolled oats to the pitcher of a blender. You can also add some ice if you prefer cold smoothies. A mix of blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries is best for a detox smoothie. They are full of antioxidants and fiber, so they can replenish your body and rid it of toxins at the same time. Be sure to rinse the berries before adding them to the smoothie.

steps.headline: Blend the mixture until it has a thick, smooth consistency.
steps.description: Pulse the blender several times times until all of the ingredients are broken down. Then turn the speed to low and gradually increase the speed to high for a total of 15 to 20 seconds blending time. You can make a larger batch of the smoothies to have servings for the future. Place the smoothie in an airtight container, and drink it within three days.

steps.headline: Pour the smoothie into two glasses.
steps.description: The recipe makes enough for two smoothies. Divide the mixture between two glasses, and enjoy.

steps.headline: Peel and slice the banana.
steps.description: For the smoothie, you’ll need 1 large banana (150 g). Remove the peel, and use a sharp knife to cut the banana into small chunks. If you prefer, you can purchase frozen, chopped banana from the grocery store.

steps.headline: Freeze the banana for a couple of hours.
steps.description: Place the chopped banana in a freezer-safe bag. Toss the bag in the freezer, and allow the banana to chill until solid, which should take about 2 hours.

steps.headline: Blend all of the ingredients in a blender.
steps.description: Once the banana is frozen, add it to the pitcher of a blender along with 1 cup (155 g) of frozen berries, 1 cup (225 g) of organic spinach or kale, 1 tablespoon (6 ½ g) of flaxseed meal, and 1 cup (237 ml) of fruit juice. Process the mixture until it is completely blended and smooth, which should take about 20 seconds. You can use whatever berries you like, but blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries are usually best for a detox smoothie. You can use your favorite fruit juice in the smoothie. Classic orange juice is a tasty option, but pomegranate juice works well too. If you don’t want to use juice, you can substitute filtered water or coconut water.

steps.headline: Pour the smoothie into glasses and enjoy.
steps.description: The recipes makes two servings. When the smoothie has reached the right consistency, divide it between two glasses and drink right away. If there is any leftover smoothie, pour it into an ice cube tray and turn them into popsicles that you can enjoy later.
